title: Jana Kramer now claims that the topless photo she found was not an 'actual person' but a 'bot'
text:
Just days after breaking down on her podcast after finding a topless photo on her husband's phone, Jana Kramer claims the photo was not 'an actual person.'

The 35-year-old Kramer and her 32-year-old sex addict husband, former NFL player Mike Caussin, appeared on Extra on Tuesday, where host Billy Bush asked Kramer if she believed her husband when he said he didn't know the person.

'I do believe that, because I know it was not an actual person. It was a bot, but I still do not believe he was going to tell me about it,' Kramer revealed.

Bot: Just days after breaking down on her podcast after finding a topless photo on her husband's phone, Jana Kramer claims the photo was not 'an actual person'

'I totally get why he would delete it and not tell me. I get that thought process 100%, it is just that the toll that the trauma takes… I don’t know how much I have left of that to cry out any more,' Kramer added.

'This has probably been the most difficult thing to date that Jana and I... everything we've shared, the most difficult to swallow,' Caussin said.

'Last night, I couldn’t sleep because I’m tired of feeling like the bad guy and it is because of my shame,' Caussin added.

Bush then asked Caussin, who played on and off in the NFL from 2010 to 2014, if other guys who have been 'struggling in the same area.'

Trauma: 'I totally get why he would delete it and not tell me. I get that thought process 100%, it is just that the toll that the trauma takes… I don’t know how much I have left of that to cry out any more,' Kramer added

Struggling: Bush then asked Caussin, who played on and off in the NFL from 2010 to 2014, if other guys who have been 'struggling in the same area'

'With the live podcast that Jana and I do, and take on tour, that is probably the most impactful feedback,' he responded.

'When we hear from men who say thank you to both of us or for opening up and enabling them to open up a little more than they would have in the past,' he added.

Bush ended the interview by calling the couple 'fascinating' and thanked them for sharing so much, which he called 'brilliant and helpful.'

Caussin said that, 'It's painful at the same time,' and Kramer added, 'I hope it all works,' with Caussin adding, 'It will.'

Feedback: 'With the live podcast that Jana and I do, and take on tour, that is probably the most impactful feedback,' he responded

Fascinating: Bush ended the interview by calling the couple 'fascinating' and thanked them for sharing so much, which he called 'brilliant and helpful'

Happened again: Kramer stated, 'I was like, it’s here. It’s happened again. I’m such a f—king idiot ... Like, how is this happening again'

On the couple's Whine Down podcast on Monday, Caussin, who has struggled with sex addiction in the past, admitted they had, 'mutually discussed and agree on... a boundary to not delete things.'

Kramer stated, 'I was like, it’s here. It’s happened again. I’m such a f—king idiot ... Like, how is this happening again.'

'I don’t want to live this kind of life. We just moved into this beautiful house, and we had our second kid, and we fought so hard. Why is this happening again?'

Her husband said that he understood that it was 'extremely triggering' for his wife to see something that was deleted.

Don't want this life: 'I don’t want to live this kind of life. We just moved into this beautiful house, and we had our second kid, and we fought so hard. Why is this happening again?'
description: Just days after breaking down on her podcast after finding a topless photo on her husband's phone, Jana Kramer claims the photo was not 'an actual person.'
